perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Books of Accounts, Records and Reports: The JVC will make and keep all books of accounts, records and reports in accordance with (i) Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and (ii) as required under the Companies Act, 1956 and other applicable laws.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Books of Accounts, Records and Reports: The JVC will make and keep all books of accounts, records and reports in accordance with company policy.
perturbation.explanation: This change omits the requirement to adhere to the Companies Act, 1956, and other applicable laws, potentially leading to non-compliance and legal issues. The original text ensures compliance with Indian accounting standards and laws, while the modified version removes this obligation.

perturbation.original_text: 19.2 Arbitration: In the event that such negotiations fail to so resolve the difference within a period of ninety (90) working days from the date of receipt of the notice by the other party, such difference shall be finally settled under the rules of the International Chamber of Commerce by arbitrator(s) appointed in accordance with the said Rules. The arbitration proceedings shall be conducted at London, United Kingdom, in the English language.
perturbation.changed_text: 19.2 Arbitration: In the event that such negotiations fail to so resolve the difference, the dispute will be resolved at a location solely decided by IMPCO. The language for resolution of disputes will be chosen by IMPCO.
perturbation.explanation: This modification allows IMPCO to unilaterally determine the location and language of arbitration, potentially creating unfair conditions and undermining the principles of fair dispute resolution. Arbitration law generally requires mutual agreement on the arbitration process.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 (India), principles of natural justice

perturbation.original_text: 24.2 Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India and the Delhi Courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any legal proceedings in respect of this Agreement. The Parties hereby stipulate irrevocably that they hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the above-referred courts and for such purpose hereby waive all and any challenges to the exclusive jurisdiction of the above referred courts.
perturbation.changed_text: 24.2 Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Delaware, U.S.A., where IMPCO Technologies Inc. is incorporated. The Parties hereby stipulate that they submit to the jurisdiction of courts within Delaware.
perturbation.explanation: Switching the governing law from Indian law to Delaware law and changing the jurisdiction to Delaware courts could disadvantage MIL/MINDA by requiring them to litigate disputes under a foreign legal system and in a foreign jurisdiction, potentially increasing costs and complexities. This could be a violation of principles of fairness and equity in contractual relationships.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of natural justice, considerations of fairness under Indian Contract Act
